00023 #ifndef __BMESH_CLASS_H__
00024 #define __BMESH_CLASS_H__
00025 
00030 /* bmesh data structures */
00031 
00032 /* dissable holes for now, these are ifdef'd because they use more memory and cant be saved in DNA currently */
00033 // #define USE_BMESH_HOLES
00034 
00035 struct BMesh;
00036 struct BMVert;
00037 struct BMEdge;
00038 struct BMLoop;
00039 struct BMFace;
00040 
00041 struct BLI_mempool;
00042 struct Object;
00043 
00044 /* note: it is very important for BMHeader to start with two
00045  * pointers. this is a requirement of mempool's method of
00046  * iteration.
00047  *
00048  * hrm. it doesn't but stull works ok, remove the comment above? - campbell.
00049  */
00050 
00063 typedef struct BMHeader {
00064     void *data; /* customdata layers */
00065     int index; /* notes:
00066                 * - Use BM_elem_index_get/set macros for index
00067                 * - Unitialized to -1 so we can easily tell its not set.
00068                 * - Used for edge/vert/face, check BMesh.elem_index_dirty for valid index values,
00069                 *   this is abused by various tools which set it dirty.
00070                 * - For loops this is used for sorting during tessellation. */
00071 
00072     char htype; /* element geometric type (verts/edges/loops/faces) */
00073     char hflag; /* this would be a CD layer, see below */
00074 } BMHeader;
00075 
00076 /* note: need some way to specify custom locations for custom data layers.  so we can
00077  * make them point directly into structs.  and some way to make it only happen to the
00078  * active layer, and properly update when switching active layers.*/
00079 
00080 typedef struct BMVert {
00081     BMHeader head;
00082     struct BMFlagLayer *oflags; /* keep after header, an array of flags, mostly used by the operator stack */
00083 
00084     float co[3];
00085     float no[3];
00086     struct BMEdge *e;
00087 } BMVert;
00088 
00089 /* disk link structure, only used by edges */
00090 typedef struct BMDiskLink {
00091     struct BMEdge *next, *prev;
00092 } BMDiskLink;
00093 
00094 typedef struct BMEdge {
00095     BMHeader head;
00096     struct BMFlagLayer *oflags; /* keep after header, an array of flags, mostly used by the operator stack */
00097 
00098     struct BMVert *v1, *v2;
00099     struct BMLoop *l;
00100     
00101     /* disk cycle pointers */
00102     BMDiskLink v1_disk_link, v2_disk_link;
00103 } BMEdge;
00104 
00105 typedef struct BMLoop {
00106     BMHeader head;
00107     /* notice no flags layer */
00108 
00109     struct BMVert *v;
00110     struct BMEdge *e; /* edge, using verts (v, next->v) */
00111     struct BMFace *f;
00112 
00113     /* circular linked list of loops which all use the same edge as this one '->e',
00114      * but not necessarily the same vertex (can be either v1 or v2 of our own '->e') */
00115     struct BMLoop *radial_next, *radial_prev;
00116 
00117     /* these were originally commented as private but are used all over the code */
00118     /* can't use ListBase API, due to head */
00119     struct BMLoop *next, *prev; /* next/prev verts around the face */
00120 } BMLoop;
00121 
00122 /* can cast BMFace/BMEdge/BMVert, but NOT BMLoop, since these don't have a flag layer */
00123 typedef struct BMElemF {
00124     BMHeader head;
00125     struct BMFlagLayer *oflags; /* keep after header, an array of flags, mostly used by the operator stack */
00126 } BMElemF;
00127 
00128 /* can cast anything to this, including BMLoop */
00129 typedef struct BMElem {
00130     BMHeader head;
00131 } BMElem;
00132 
00133 #ifdef USE_BMESH_HOLES
00134 /* eventually, this structure will be used for supporting holes in faces */
00135 typedef struct BMLoopList {
00136     struct BMLoopList *next, *prev;
00137     struct BMLoop *first, *last;
00138 } BMLoopList;
00139 #endif
00140 
00141 typedef struct BMFace {
00142     BMHeader head;
00143     struct BMFlagLayer *oflags; /* an array of flags, mostly used by the operator stack */
00144 
00145     int len; /*includes all boundary loops*/
00146 #ifdef USE_BMESH_HOLES
00147     int totbounds; /*total boundaries, is one plus the number of holes in the face*/
00148     ListBase loops;
00149 #else
00150     BMLoop *l_first;
00151 #endif
00152     float no[3]; /*yes, we do store this here*/
00153     short mat_nr;
00154 } BMFace;
00155 
00156 typedef struct BMFlagLayer {
00157     short f, pflag; /* flags */
00158 } BMFlagLayer;
00159 
00160 typedef struct BMesh {
00161     int totvert, totedge, totloop, totface;
00162     int totvertsel, totedgesel, totfacesel;
00163 
00164     /* flag index arrays as being dirty so we can check if they are clean and
00165      * avoid looping over the entire vert/edge/face array in those cases.
00166      * valid flags are - BM_VERT | BM_EDGE | BM_FACE.
00167      * BM_LOOP isn't handled so far. */
00168     char elem_index_dirty;
00169     
00170     /*element pools*/
00171     struct BLI_mempool *vpool, *epool, *lpool, *fpool;
00172 
00173     /*operator api stuff*/
00174     struct BLI_mempool *toolflagpool;
00175     int stackdepth;
00176     struct BMOperator *currentop;
00177     
00178     CustomData vdata, edata, ldata, pdata;
00179 
00180 #ifdef USE_BMESH_HOLES
00181     struct BLI_mempool *looplistpool;
00182 #endif
00183 
00184     /* should be copy of scene select mode */
00185     /* stored in BMEditMesh too, this is a bit confusing,
00186      * make sure they're in sync!
00187      * Only use when the edit mesh cant be accessed - campbell */
00188     short selectmode;
00189     
00190     /*ID of the shape key this bmesh came from*/
00191     int shapenr;
00192     
00193     int walkers, totflags;
00194     ListBase selected, error_stack;
00195     
00196     BMFace *act_face;
00197 
00198     ListBase errorstack;
00199 
00200     void *py_handle;
00201 
00202     int opflag; /* current operator flag */
00203 } BMesh;
00204 
00205 /* BMHeader->htype (char) */
00206 enum {
00207     BM_VERT = 1,
00208     BM_EDGE = 2,
00209     BM_LOOP = 4,
00210     BM_FACE = 8
00211 };
00212 
00213 #define BM_ALL (BM_VERT | BM_EDGE | BM_LOOP | BM_FACE)
00214 
00215 /* BMHeader->hflag (char) */
00216 enum {
00217     BM_ELEM_SELECT  = (1 << 0),
00218     BM_ELEM_HIDDEN  = (1 << 1),
00219     BM_ELEM_SEAM    = (1 << 2),
00220     BM_ELEM_SMOOTH  = (1 << 3), /* used for faces and edges, note from the user POV,
00221                                  * this is a sharp edge when disabled */
00222 
00223     BM_ELEM_TAG     = (1 << 4), /* internal flag, used for ensuring correct normals
00224                                  * during multires interpolation, and any other time
00225                                  * when temp tagging is handy.
00226                                  * always assume dirty & clear before use. */
00227 
00228     /* we have 2 spare flags which is awesome but since we're limited to 8
00229      * only add new flags with care! - campbell */
00230     /* BM_ELEM_SPARE  = (1 << 5), */
00231     /* BM_ELEM_SPARE  = (1 << 6), */
00232 
00233     BM_ELEM_INTERNAL_TAG = (1 << 7) /* for low level internal API tagging,
00234                                      * since tools may want to tag verts and
00235                                      * not have functions clobber them */
00236 };

00242 #ifdef USE_BMESH_HOLES
00243 #  define BM_FACE_FIRST_LOOP(p) (((BMLoopList *)((p)->loops.first))->first)
00244 #else
00245 #  define BM_FACE_FIRST_LOOP(p) ((p)->l_first)
00246 #endif

00248 /* size to use for static arrays when dealing with NGons,
00249  * alloc after this limit is reached.
00250  * this value is rather arbitrary */
00251 #define BM_NGON_STACK_SIZE 32
00252 
00253 /* avoid inf loop, this value is arbitrary
00254  * but should not error on valid cases */
00255 #define BM_LOOP_RADIAL_MAX 10000
00256 #define BM_NGON_MAX 100000

00258 #endif /* __BMESH_CLASS_H__ */
